Description: Mould-made pottery oil-lamp, miniature, with two nozzles. Unpierced (broken) handle, with handle-ornament above, the face decorated with a palmette. Plain discus. Fine orange-brown Nile silt, covered with a yellow surface. Plaster mould. Handle-ornament damaged.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Broneer XXI minature lamp (Bailey 1988, Q1922, also see Q1920, Q1942). Close: Shier, L.A., 1978. ‘Terracotta Lamps from Karanis, Egypt’. Ann Arbor : University of Michigan Press, 318-19, from Karanis, with context-dates of the third century and the middle of the second century. Near: Birmingham Museum Inv. No. 253'57.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KE.08) (Phase 3)
